name: boom-completion
description: Bash and Zsh completion for Boom

repo.name: boom
repo.description: Motherfucking TEXT SNIPPETS! On the COMMAND LINE!

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and quick start with engaging examples, but completely lacks configuration options, troubleshooting guidance, and Homebrew-specific installation context.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section for common issues (clipboard problems, storage location, command conflicts) and installation shows gem instead of brew despite being a Homebrew package.

injection_risks.description: The `execute` method uses user input to determine which command to execute, but it does not properly validate or sanitize the input. This could potentially lead to a command injection vulnerability.
The `open` method uses user input to determine which item to open, but it does not properly validate or sanitize the input. This could potentially lead to a command injection vulnerability.

critical_findings: Potential command injection vulnerability in the `execute` method
Lack of input validation and sanitization
security.summary: The boom-completion package has some security concerns, including potential command injection vulnerabilities and a lack of input validation and sanitization, but no critical secrets or error exposure issues were found.

common_complaints: Shell quoting issues (single quotes stripped from snippets)
Missing command-line completion despite multiple requests
Error handling for edge cases (empty .boom file, name conflicts)
praise_themes: Helpful for workflow automation (Slack gifs, commonly used commands)
sentiment.summary: Project shows severe abandonment with 6+ year old open issues unanswered, no maintainer engagement, critical bugs unfixed (quote stripping), and repeated feature requests (completion, Homebrew) ignored for years.

red_flags: lack of detailed explanations for decisions
communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are generally adequate but could benefit from more clarity and depth in explanations.

concerns: No commits in over 2 years (last commit February 2023)
No activity in past 6 months across all metrics
7 open issues with no resolution or triage
No merged PRs in past 6 months indicating no active development
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release process has stalled
maintenance.summary: Package is abandoned with no commits, releases, or maintenance activity for over 2 years and accumulating unaddressed issues.

changelog.summary: The changelog lacks clear categorization, marked breaking changes, and migration guides, making it difficult for users to understand the evolution of the package.

project_metrics.description: Motherfucking TEXT SNIPPETS! On the COMMAND LINE!

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is clear and engaging, but lacks comprehensive installation instructions, configuration details, and troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: No commits in the past six months
Open issues and PRs suggest potential problems
Docs: Installation instructions are incomplete, as they only provide a gem install command without specifying any potential dependencies or Homebrew-specific instructions.
Communication: lack of detailed explanations for decisions
Security: Potential command injection vulnerability in the `execute` method
Security: Lack of input validation and sanitization
highlights: There have been no merged PRs, which could indicate a pause or issue with merging
